tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 息長宿禰王（おきながのすくねのみこ、生没年不詳）は、2世紀頃の日本の皇族。
sen.e: Okinaga no sukune no miko (息長宿禰王; year of birth and death unknown; around the second century) was a member of the Imperial family.
sen.cmt: 後列に同じ読み方で表記の違うものが出ているので、ここも漢字を併記しました。
sen.e: Okinaga no sukune no miko (息長宿禰王; year of birth and death unknown; around the second century) was a member of the Imperial family.
Okinaga no sukune no miko (息長宿禰王; year of birth and death unknown; around the second century) was a member of the Imperial family.

sen.j: 第9代開化天皇玄孫で、迦邇米雷王の王子。
sen.e: He was a great-great grandchild of the ninth emperor of Japan, the Emperor Kaika, and is a prince of Kanimeikazuchi no miko.
He was a great-great grandchild of the ninth emperor of Japan, the Emperor Kaika, and was a prince of Kanimeikazuchi no miko.
He was a great-great grandchild of the ninth emperor of Japan, the Emperor Kaika, and was a prince of Kanimeikazuchi no miko.

sen.j: 母は丹波之遠津臣の女・高材比売。
sen.e: His mother was Takakihime, a daughter of Taniha no towotsuomi.
His mother was Takakihime, a daughter of Taniha no totsuomi.
His mother was Takakihime, a daughter of Taniha no totsuomi.

sen.j: 神功皇后の父王として知られる。
sen.e: He is known as a father of the Empress Jingu.
He is known as a father of the Empress Jingu.
He is known as a father of the Empress Jingu.
His name is also expressed as 気長宿禰王.
His name is also expressed as 気長宿禰王.
His name is also expressed as 気長宿禰王.

sen.j: 王は河俣稲依毘売との間に大多牟坂王を儲ける。
sen.e: From Kawamata no inayoribime, he had a prince called Ohotamusaka no o.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From Kawamata no inayoribime, he had a prince called Otamusaka no miko.
sen.cmt: Ohotamusaka no o→Otamusaka no mikoとしました。(参考: http://www.nihonjiten.com/data/263237.html)
sen.e: From Kawamata no inayoribime, he had a prince called Otamusaka no miko.

sen.j: 天之日矛の後裔・葛城之高額比売との間に神功皇后（おきながたらしひめのみこと）、虚空津比売命（そらつひめのみこと）、息長日子王（おきながひこのみこ）を儲ける。
sen.e: From Katsuragi no takanukahime (a descendant of Amenohiboko), he had Okinagatarashihime no mikoto, Soratsuhime no mikoto and Okinagahiko no miko.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処；原文に神功皇后とあるのはリンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると「息長帯比売命」（おきながたらしひめのみこと）となっているので、これで訳出しています。
sen.e: From Katsuragi no takanukahime (a descendant of Amenohiboko), he had Okinagatarashihime no mikoto, Soratsuhime no mikoto and Okinagahiko no miko.
From Katsuragi no takanukahime (a descendant of Amenohiboko), he had Okinagatarashihime no mikoto, Soratsuhime no mikoto and Okinagahiko no miko.

sen.j: 息長帯比売命は後に神功皇后と諡される。
sen.e: Okinagatarashihime no mikoto is later called the Empress Jingu.
Okinagatarashihime no mikoto was later called the Empress Jingu.
Okinagatarashihime no mikoto was later called the Empress Jingu.

sen.j: 王は少毘古名命・応神天皇と並び滋賀県米原市・日撫神社に祀られている。
sen.e: He is enshrined in Hinade-jinja Shrine located in Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture together with Sukunahikona no mikoto and the Emperor Ojin.
He is enshrined in Hinade-jinja Shrine located in Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture together with Sukunahikona no mikoto and the Emperor Ojin.
He is enshrined in Hinade-jinja Shrine located in Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture together with Sukunahikona no mikoto and the Emperor Ojin.

sen.j: また、明治15年(1882年)に米原市・山津照神社境内から発見された前方後円墳（山津照神社古墳）は息長宿禰王の墓という。
sen.e: A large keyhole-shaped tomb mound found in 1882 in the precincts of Yamatsuteru-jinja Shrine in Maibara City (Yamatsutera-jinja Shrine Tomb) is considered to be that of Okinaga no sukune no miko.
A large keyhole-shaped tomb mound found in 1882 in the precincts of Yamatsuteru-jinja Shrine in Maibara City (Yamatsutera-jinja Shrine Tomb) is considered to be that of Okinaga no sukune no miko.
A large keyhole-shaped tomb mound found in 1882 in the precincts of Yamatsuteru-jinja Shrine in Maibara City (Yamatsutera-jinja Shrine Tomb) is considered to be that of Okinaga no sukune no miko.
